title: Nutrition Problem Solved
review: I've ordered a total of 4 of these cups. They work great for drinking smoothies, creamed soups, and other similar foods. I've been unable to chew foods while waiting for facial reconstruction surgery and these have been the perfect solution. I was rapidly losing weight from not being able to eat before finding these cups.As the description says, they can be used laying down, but I use them sitting up. They're easy to wash by hand, or put on top DW shelf. I don't put them in the microwave, I heat the soup in a glass measuring cup first, then pour into the cup. I don't use any plastic in the DW. When my surgeon asked how I've been eating I told him about these cups, he was very impressed. He told me they will also be perfect to use after surgery during my recovery time.The only negative is that tomato soup does slightly stain the inside of the cup, but that's true of any tomato product and plastic. There's no residual smell or taste, just slightly discolored. When I noticed that I marked that cup to be the only one I use for tomato soup or others that may stain.

title: Lewy Who?
review: This cup has been great for my brother who has Lewy Body Dementia (the 2nd most common form of degenerative dementia, after Alzheimer's, and includes motor control and stiffness, like Parkinson's). He doesn't have great control of his hands, so the small (but not tiny) size of the cup has worked well for him. He can get a good grip on it. He uses it with a flexible straw with the flexy part in the bottom of the cup, so if he's reclined the straw is still in the drink. [...]

title: A big help for the bedbound
review: My father has late stage lung cancer and is now so weak that he is mostly bedbound. This cup has made drinking without spilling easier for him. Straws help, but require a lot of maneuvering to avoid tipping the cup too much. This, on the other hand, allows full tilting without frustrating spills. It also doesn't look like a child's cup, which would have embarrassed my dad. I love whoever came up with this. Thank you so much.

title: It really does help
review: This is my second order.  I ordered the first one and it worked very well for my elderly mother who has trouble eating and swallowing due to vascular dementia.  I have mixed pureed food with a little liquid to make it more like a creamy soup and give it to her that way.  This cup has substantially decreased the amount of spillage when spoon feeding her.  With the cup, her intake is much greater with less mess.  The mouth hole size is very good and you are actually able to control the amount.  She has been fed in bed while slightly reclined.  Additionally, she likes the cup as well.  I use the first for soup/food and the second for drinks like Ensure.  Lastly, a great price!

title: Thanks to only two parts is easy to clean and sanitize
review: I have 2 of these for my father who is on hospice and requires nectar thick liquids. It's spout hole is large enough for a larger plastic straw and accommodates the flow of thicker fluids. When he tips it to drink I can control the flow with the hole on the opposite side of the lid. The spout also decreases his confusion about what side to drink from when he is able to drink on his own. This is not spill proof, but spill reducing. Although the lid is simple to remove I have found it remains attached to the cup even when knocked over or dropped. Thanks to only two parts is easy to clean and sanitize.

title: Great Lightweight Cup for Handicapped Adults
review: The cup I received is just as pictured. I ordered it for my mom who only has the use of one hand and has trouble swallowing due to a stroke. She uses it with and without the lid and can easily remove it by herself with one hand. She learned easily how to control the flow of the liquid. Previously we were using glasses with weighted bottoms because she has a tendency to knock them over accidentally, but the only ones she could grasp only held 4 ozs and we were having to buy new ones frequently because they were constantly being broken. I switched to these and I'm very glad I did. They hold 8 ozs and she has no trouble with them at all. I also like that they are top shelf dishwasher safe. The lid stays on pretty well but will come off if dropped onto the floor.

title: Great cup (for one day...)
review: Cup arrived quickly and looked promising. I bought this for my elderly aunt who has Alzheimers and is bedridden much of the time. She loved the cup, as she could drink while in a reclining position.  Unfortunately she dropped the cup at the end of the first day from her bed and part of the plastic broke off (see photo).  It's the part that you pry off and on to fill. I would have given it 5 stars IF that hadn't happened...and after just a a few hours use...I also bought some dual handled plastic cups and those were too heavy for her so this one would have been the ideal one.

title: These allowed her to lay in a more comfortable position and still drink
review: Mom was bed-bound the last 6 months of her life. We had a hospital bed that allowed her to sit upright but it was uncomfortable for her. These allowed her to lay in a more comfortable position and still drink. I kept one always full of water by her bed. I also gave her morning juice and nutritional supplement in them. I ended up buying extras so I always had a couple clean. They are safe for hot liquids too, but she didn't like her tea in plastic - that was just her preference though and not a fault of the product.

title: Disappointing, only for truly bedridden who don’t mind leaks.
review: You control flow by blocking the air hole in cap. Lid slides in, doesn’t screw in, so not secure. Take in A LOT of air, which after abdominal surgery is a no-no & you don’t sip out the end of the spout...it’s out of the top, which is wide enough for a straw. Lastly, measurements are NOT accurate.

title: Very helpful for my dad
review: My dad has a health issue that is causing his swallow-reflex to weaken.  As a result, he chokes easily, and is weak enough that it can get serious.  This cup has dramatically lessened his choking.  The hole is on the side of the spout, not the end, and that simple change makes it much easier for him to regulate the flow of liquid, to avoid choking.  We have bought three of them now.

title: but this is not nearly as bad as the entire glass of liquid spilling
review: My husband who has Parkinson Disease was spilling drinks often.  These cups work well.  If they do get knocked over a little liquid does spill out, but this is not nearly as bad as the entire glass of liquid spilling.  Yes, they are boring in looks, but the plain white manages to be not bad with other dishes.  they are reasonably priced with no shipping charge, so we could order just one to see how they worked before buying more.

title: Good for thick liquids. Lid comes off to easy.
review: Cup design is great. Using for adult dementia who is on thick liquids. Only negative is the lid comes off to easy. She takes it off, or it flies off if she drops the cup.

title: disappointed
review: Lid is not snug in how it fits in to cup- would be better if it screwed on maybe. I returned as I was afraid my grandfather would spill the whole cup on himself if lid slid off. Amazon really helpful on return.

title: life saver
review: my mother has had several strokes and has advanced Alzheimer's. This has literately saved her life. She is unable to eat and drink herself so we can feed her liquid meal substitutes which has made her more comfortable

title: Vacuum control doesn't work. Not graduated.
review: I got this for a client with dementia, and the vacuum control just doesn't work; I almost drowned him with it! The lid is slip-fit into the cup, so I don't think it makes a vacuum. It's not a bad cup, but the flow control was what we needed and what this cup's claim to fame was. It's also not graduated (marked like a measuring cup) as expected.

title: While the idea of the cup is great, he is entirely unable to control his fingers ...
review: The product is as shown.  It make work for some, but the product info really needs to be updated.  It does not state that the user has to hold a finger over the hole, to control the flow of liquid.  I purchased this for my brother, who has end stage MS.  While the idea of the cup is great, he is entirely unable to control his fingers to cover the hole.  Thank you Amazon for processing my return easily!

title: Minimal flow control with water or thin liquids, leakproof lid, excellent straw holder
review: Bought this to help my convalescing patient (who was too weak to use straws) drink fluids.  The flow control is minimal with thin liquids, and the mouthpiece is awkward.  The mouthpiece seems to be designed to hold a straw rather than fit in the mouth.  And if you use this cup with a straw, flow control is unnecessary.  I could not use this product to give water and thin liquids to my bedridden patient.  It may work well with thicker liquids, however.  But the lid is watertight and I find I am using it frequently as a straw holder cup now that my patient is stronger.

title: Not good for bed bound people
review: Not good for my family member. Water shoots out the little hole if you don't have your finger covering it. Also the lid doesn't snap on or screw on it just kinda slides on. The lid came off several times. I ended up buying a toddler supply cup. Do not recommend this cup for someone that cannot sit up to drink.

title: Love This Cup!
review: I got this cup for my ailing mother and it has more than met my expectations. Hubby was skeptical at first, but soon saw how much it helped mom to drink liquids more comfortably. Highly recommend it!!!

title: Child’s sippy cup works better than this!
review: If you or a member of your family is bedridden and can’t sit up to drink and you order this cup for them, buy them a towel as well.  They will get wet whether they put a finger over the hole or not.  Flow is not decreased at all.  A child’s sippy cup works better and will prevent a soaking.

title: A bit pricey for an adult "sippy" cup, but worth it.
review: My husband is starting to have issues with dysphasia. He felt comfortable with this cup right away as he can control the flow of the liquid so easily and slow things down. Easy to clean (I hand wash it). Thick durable plastic, not cheap and thin. He can be in a semi-prone position and still drink safely. It has also helped to eliminate accidental spills.

title: Great cup for elderly
review: At first I didn’t like this cup & thought it was too small but after giving it a second chance I love it.It is just the right size, and doesn’t spill .My moms hand shake and not even a drop spoils w

title: Spill proof with measurements.
review: Clear plastic mug for elderly with muscle or arthritis weakness. There is no handles so you will have to assist. The good thing  is the measurement Amounts printed on the side.

title: Not as described
review: Doesn't work as described. According to the description, you should be able to tip this cup without water spilling out as long as you have your finger over the hole. This is not the case. All covering the hole does is slow the flow.

title: A great purchase!
review: Loved everything!Used a straw and sipper as well. My dad was 94 and only cup that he could use with ease. We had to hold it for him but no problem as long as he could get his liquids.Big enough to function properly.What was important,  no dripping. A must have!

title: Fantastic cup / Fantástico vaso
review: ENGLISH: This cup for people with disabilities has been a fantastic help to feed a relative with disabilities. We use several at a time, for different kinds of drinks. There is a model with the smaller hole, but for us this has been most useful model for thick drinks. The cap seal and prevent spillage.ESPAÑOL: Este vaso para personas con discapacidad ha sido de gran ayuda para alimentar a un pariente con discapacidad. Usamos varios a la vez, para diferentes clases de bebidas. Existe un modelo con el orificio más pequeño, pero para nosotros este modelo ha sido más útil para las bebidas espesas. La tapa cierra herméticamente y se evitan los derrames.

title: Good night table cup
review: I want a glass of water on my bedside table but more often than not I knock it over or spill it down my front as I try to take a sip in the night. I am not convalescing just clumsy. I liked the idea of a soppy cup but could not stand the thought of Mickey Mouse or some other character being on my bedside table. This fits the bill

title: Did not meet my needs
review: Cup was needed for an adult .  The cup is TOO small and lid too tight for an aging adult to get off.  Very disappointed

title: Too small
review: Too small for an adult, and hard for my mom to sip on.

title: Just what he needed
review: My son is experiencing the onset of dysphagia and this cup is exactly what we needed to assist him with eating the foods he loves.

title: Waste of Money
review: This does not work at all. I place my finger over the vent hole, and the beverage still pours out. This was a complete waste of money!

title: Great for Mom!
review: This cup is substantial, easy to use and clean. It does not come apart, but is easy to take apart.

title: It is SMALL.
review: Not worth the money......It is way to small for someone that needs to drink 60 oz of water a day.  This thing is worthless for my wife.

title: exactly what my wife needed with suffering from huntington's disease ...
review: exactly what my wife needed with suffering from huntington's disease hdsa.org  able to control flow rate with vent hole

title: Highly recommend this cup
review: I Purchased this cup for my mom who is 87 years old. Gave her confidence to sip her water by herself. I definitely recommend this cup

title: Great for seniors
review: I bought to help my grandma drink in end stages of dementia. I was able to control the flow of liquid so she didnt choke. It worked perfect.

title: Adult "sippy" cup
review: This cup is perfect for my elderly Mother. She tends to spill regular cups, so this adult "sippy" cup is ideal. The cup is rather small but ok volume for Mom.

title: Helped My Mom Who Suffered a Stroke
review: I bought this for my mom who had a small stroke and had a hard time learning to swallow again.  This cup helped her limit the flow into her mouth and as a result, she wouldn't choke as often.  A straw can fit in the opening so that helped her on occasion.

title: Like it
review: The tip length is exaggerated in the photo. It is about half of that. Not complaining. It is just what I wanted.

title: Great for post wisdom teeth removal
review: This is a great cup to use after wisdom teeth removal.  You cannot use straws after this surgery, so this cup worked great.

title: Terrific
review: Used for a Parkinson's patient who was spilling multiple glasses of liquid every day.  No more spills, if the glass is tipped over a little spills out but that is it.

title: I am a little disappointed that the stopper was not included with the cup ...
review: I am a little disappointed that the stopper was not included with the cup itself, which ultimately defeats the purpose of why it is generally purchased. For some

title: Great Idea
review: Clever adaption of cup lid to assist people with swallowing problems.

title: Easy does it
review: My wife has Trigeminal neuralgia, a severely painful condition that often limits her ability to speak, eat or drink. The flow control on this cup is perfect for the times she can only ingest fluids. I always keep a pair on hand.

title: Helpful
review: I bought two of these for my husband.  He is 87 yrs old, with arthritis in his hands.  I don't have to worry about the glass (plastic) being too heavy for him.  Less spill too, if he does drop it, because of the lid.  For elderly, do wish it had some grids on the sides though .... Guess that would help children too.

title: Not what I needed
review: This cup would be great if the cover screwed on. To easy to spill.

title: great find!
review: works perfect for my mom, who spills things. Perfect size, I put a straw in the mouthpiece and mom doesn't have to tilt it back too far.

title: use with caustion
review: Works okay however uncovered rim of cup is excessively sharp

title: It does not control the flow.
review: The instructions state "to stop the liquid from flowing, place a finger back over the vent hole". This barely slows the flow.

title: Cup does leak if turned over
review: My dad would knock over his drink constantly. The cup leaked.

title: Nice cup
review: Wish all assisted livings and nursing homes would use. I dislike seeing toddler cups being used.

title: Five Stars
review: works great for my mom with dementia

title: Larger spout opening is great for adults.
review: Works well. The larger opening at the spout, is great. I ordered more..just a idea..make them in a larger cup size, using with Alzheimer's patients

title: Good enough quiality
review: Works perfect for my mom that has Parkinson's. Not five stars because when you put your finger on the little hole it doesn't completely stop the flow.

title: Good cup to drink in bed
review: Good product, use it to moisten my parched throat without getting up at night. However, a drop or two does spill. Wish the spout was a bit narrower. Still it serves my purpose.

title: Great product
review: This works well, my hubby loved while i was taking care of him.  It didn't matter the liquid, thick like boost or thin like ice tea, it worked well.  For a bed ridden person, this is a great.

title: NOT A FEEDING CUP
review: THIS IS NOT A FEEDING CUP THIS IS A DRINKING CUPO DO BUY IT AS A FEEDING CUP BUT IT IS NOT

title: Don't be fooled
review: Doesn't work as described. According to the description, you should be able to tip this cup without water spilling out as long as you have your finger over the hole. This is not the case. All covering the hole does is slow the flow.

title: cup
review: too small, doesn't  do the job

title: It would leak water all over me when I tried ...
review: It would leak water all over me when I tried to take my medicine early in the morning.  I finally gave up on it.

title: He said he could drink and adjust the flow whill laying down.
review: Just as described

title: Drinking cup
review: Cracked already and water went all over

title: Needed something that my mom could use for her morning ...
review: Needed something that my mom could use for her morning juice and this works well.  Small/light enough for her little hand and no more spills

title: Two Stars
review: Leaks from the lid. I use it for my wife who has MS. Drips on her shirt/dress.

title: Great for elderly or kids
review: I love these cups! Easy to drink from with or without a straw. Lids fit tight. Sturdy but lightweight. Pop them in the dishwasher.

title: Excellent Cup
review: This item was purchased for my bed-ridden mother.  This enabled us to provide liquids to her safely.  We used a straw with the cup to make it easier for her to drink.

title: Four Stars
review: This was bought for my mother, who used it daily, without any difficulty.

title: Five Stars
review: Works very well for nursing home residents.

title: Five Stars
review: Works great!

title: No vacuum control
review: Holding your finger over the hole does nothing. The cup makes it easier to drink with less spills but one could choke if unable to lift their head. Disappointing.

title: Good quality
review: Perfect for my daughter

title: Spout was too large
review: Bought this for my elderly mom who had aspiration problems but the spout opening was too big, same as a straw so never used it. Ended up using baby sippee cups from Dollar Tree.

title: Five Stars
review: Didn't work very good for us......

title: Perfect after jaw surgery
review: Tried many different cups but once I tried this one the hunt was over.

review: doesn't work for my mother's purpose.  Too small -- I didn't pay attention to dimensions when I ordered

title: One Star
review: Not controlled flow and lid pops off if dropped

title: Save your money!
review: Save your money! The water flow is extremely difficult to control. I returned it 4 something much better.

title: No good for a baby or disabled adult
review: No good.

title: Very happy costumer
review: Very happy this product.... recommend

title: This cup is great for patients with dementia or in our case alzheimers
review: This cup is great for patients with dementia or in our case alzheimers.  If they throw or drop the cup the top stays on.  Great buy that arrived on time and works as described.  My only suggestion would be a handle for the patient to grasp.

title: Five Stars
review: perfect for my ill husband

title: Great price though
review: I have ALS, and I thought this would eliminate my straw difficulties. However, I require others to feed me, so  it's taking more practice. Great price though!!

title: Two Stars
review: Cheap

title: Three Stars
review: patient has trouble drinking laying down

title: Five Stars
review: As expected

title: Too small and still leaks. If it has a ...
review: Too small and still leaks.  If it has a lid, and if it’s for a convalescent, it should be spill proof.

title: Great idea for people that are confined to bed, or that might otherwise spill a drink due to physical limitations or disability.
review: My father-in-law is stuck in bed, he can't walk, no walker no wheelchair can help him. He was drinking water out of plastic water bottles, he struggled because the bottles would crumble in his hand, thus it reduced the amount of water intake and that's bad, so I found this cup on Amazon. He liked it so much I ordered another the same day the first one arrived. He drinks more water than ever. The pour spout is smooth and works welol without spills. I would recommend this product! Great idea, great product.

title: Can puree whole fruit!
review: I've been puree whole lemons, limes & grapefruit! Awesome!

title: Five Stars
review: Works great

title: Five Stars
review: My daughter needed this for jaw surgery. Lifesaving!!

title: Great cups
review: Great cups wish these had handles but works great

title: Quality product no leakage
review: Just exactly what I was looking for -works great!

title: Will diffienty buy again
review: My father loves it.

title: Five Stars
review: Great non-spill cup. I have a total of 6 of these and loved it.

title: Life saver
review: An absolute must have for oral/jaw post-op.

title: Five Stars
review: The best for my 89 yo mother that spills beverages daily. High quality. Will buy more.

title: Five Stars
review: The cup was great for my granddaughter.

title: Good at keeping a straw stable
review: My mother hasn't used these to drink lying down, but they are good at keeping a straw relatively stable and offer some protection from spillage.

title: Five Stars
review: great

title: Four Stars
review: The flow cups are nice and were delivered on time.

title: Five Stars
review: Great

title: Five Stars
review: Worked great for my disables husband.

title: The cup its self is fine, just not what was pictured
review: I did not receive what was pictured. I needed cups with a larger opening for thickened liquids. The cup I received had a small opening and a button to control flow. The cup its self is fine, just not what was pictured, Not what I needed.

title: Not the best choice
review: The lid isn't tight - i'm afraid of spillage and the cup is smaller than I expected.

title: it was too small, and you could hardly read ...
review: it was too small, and you could hardly read the marking's in the cup where it's supposed to give you the ounces.

title: how does it work
review: dont know how it works still fast flo for someone who is laying down could choke how to use know directions

title: Vacuum control does not work !
review: These cups are OK for someone who can drink pretty well.  However, holding your finger over the hole does NOT stop the flow.  Your designers should try it before they release it!  Also, if the convalescent bites down on the spout it can lever the fairly loose fitting cover off and spill the drink down his front.

title: Great All Around Cups
review: These cups are great.  I used them for my husband throughout his illness.  Since then, I have moved into a studio apartment and use them to avoid "mop ups" in case I tip the cup over - there is minimal liquid to clean up.  My current ones are about 10 years old and still no problems with the lids sealing on.

title: buyer beware
review: pls be aware - this cup has sharp razor edges that will cut people.  they will not return - pls  be careful.  i purchased these cups from the wright stuff co and they wanted to charge me a 20% restock when the product was actually dangerous.

title: It works
review: This was very useful to my husband during his final illness. He could turn his head on the pillow and drink from it without spilling.

title: Great cup a little small however by it being small ...
review: Great cup a little small however by it being small it is also light weight. I use it for my dad who has difficulty swallowing after a stroke.  We have to use honey thick liquids and they flow through the hole in the spout just fine.

title: Great spill-proof product!!
review: My dad used these cups when he was in an ortho-rehab facility.  When he came home, he still had difficulty drinking out of a regular cup.  I searched the internet and finally ordered from Amazon because they had the best price!!  The vendor is quick and the orders are filled accurately.  This is my second order; and two other families ordered them as well!  Awesome product!

title: Five Stars
review: Very helpful for my Mom

title: works great
review: I bought this cup for my father who is bedridden now, and has become very weak in lifting things. This works perfectly. So I am happy with the purchase.

title: Great cup for elderly and surgery recovery!
review: Works as advertised.  Very helpful following my surgery and recovery!

title: Five Stars
review: Great product and a great price
